comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: No Wright model here. This is an in flight Antoinette IV (no ailerons) during a flight demonstration with a very large crowd of paying (I hope) viewers. The Antoinette IV was a French plane designed by Léon Levavasseur, which was very successful in the pre-1914 years.

comment.author: 68439219@N06
comment._content:
"Second Annual International Aviation Meet" , Dominguez Aero Park
December 24, 1910 - January 3, 1911 ( Los Angeles Herald Advertisement December 26, 1910) Grandstands in background show photo taken at Dominquez

Pilot: Hubert Latham    Aero Club of France Pilot # 9   August 17, 1909
